intro: Anemone narcissiflora var. yuldussica, commonly known as the Yuldus Mountain Anemone, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features showy, white to pale pink flowers that resemble those of the narcissus, hence its common name. The plant has basal leaves that are palmately divided, with a hairy texture that helps it retain moisture in arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing at high altitudes. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
